comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: This list www.lbscr.demon.co.uk/locos/Beyer-Peacock.html seems to indicate that this is a Beyer Peacock Standard Passenger Loco 2-4-0 that ran on the London, Brighton and South Coast Railway between 1864 and 1888.

comment.author: 61498590@N03
comment._content: Thanks for the information! I've  looked at a high resolution image of the photograph, and the coal car does seem to bear a Beyer, Peacock & Co. manufacturer's plate above the center wheel. Very interesting. Thanks again.
